definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: LITTER. See that your birding haunts are kept tidy.
sentences.chinese: 应保持赏鸟地点的清洁。

sentences.english: Bird watching? Yes, my son actually works in a zoo.
sentences.chinese: 赏鸟？是的，事实上我的儿子在动物园里工作。

sentences.english: She has gone in for bird-watching since she moved to London.
sentences.chinese: 她自从搬到伦敦，就热衷于赏鸟。

definition: to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
(bird species of China) black-faced spoonbill (Platalea minor)
(bird species of China) Saunders's gull (Chroicocephalus saundersi)
(bird species of China) Chinese pond heron (Ardeola bacchus)
(bird species of China) black-necked crane (Grus nigricollis)
lit. tread the green; go for a walk in the spring (when the grass has turned green)/spring hike season around Qingming festival 清明, 4th-6th April
